title: 112_hr1447
content: The Act titled "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" establishes the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee is established under Subchapter II of chapter 449 of title 49, United States Code. It advises the Assistant Secretary on aviation security matters, policies, programs, and directives. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee advises the Assistant Secretary on aviation security policies, programs, and directives, and develops recommendations for improvements to aviation security. Working group recommendations must be approved by the Advisory Committee before being transmitted to the Assistant Secretary. The Advisory Committee established under this section must approve recommendations for transmission to the Assistant Secretary. The Committee must submit periodic reports on identified matters and an annual report on activities, findings, and recommendations. The Assistant Secretary appoints members of the Advisory Committee within 180 days of enactment, consisting of representatives from up to 27 member organizations. The Advisory Committee consists of representatives from 27 member organizations, each represented by one individual or designee. Membership includes representatives from various sectors such as air carriers, cargo air transportation, labor organizations, aircraft manufacturers, airport operators, general aviation, privacy, the travel industry, and aviation technology security industry. The Advisory Committee consists of representatives from 27 member organizations in the aviation industry, including air carriers, cargo air transportation, labor organizations, aircraft manufacturers, airport operators, general aviation, privacy, the travel industry, and aviation technology security industry. The Assistant Secretary has the authority to remove members for cause and they are not allowed to receive compensation. Meetings are required to be held at least semiannually. The Assistant Secretary requires the Advisory Committee to meet at least semiannually and may convene additional meetings as needed. An air cargo security working group within the Advisory Committee provides recommendations on air cargo security issues, including the implementation of security programs for screening air cargo on passenger and all-cargo aircraft. The air cargo security working group established by the Transportation Security Administration meets quarterly to provide recommendations on improving cargo security initiatives for passenger and all-cargo aircraft. The Transportation Security Administration's air cargo security working group meets regularly to enhance cargo security initiatives for passenger and all-cargo aircraft. Additionally, a general aviation security working group within the Advisory Committee provides recommendations on security issues for general aviation facilities and aircraft. The general aviation security working group meets quarterly to provide recommendations on transportation security issues for general aviation facilities, aircraft, and helicopter operations at airports. The group includes members with expertise in general aviation. The airport perimeter security working group, established within the Advisory Committee, includes members with expertise in general aviation and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. Meetings are held quarterly to provide recommendations on airport perimeter security and access control issues. The airport perimeter security working group, part of the Advisory Committee, meets quarterly to address security and access control issues at commercial service and general aviation airports. The group includes experts in airport security and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee, cochaired by a Government and industry official, is exempt from the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Definitions for terms like "Advisory Committee" and "Assistant Secretary" are provided in this section. The annual report required under subsection (a) is defined in this section, along with the term "Assistant Secretary" referring to the Assistant Secretary of Homeland Security. Perimeter security is defined as procedures to monitor and secure airport areas to prevent unauthorized access. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of perimeter security at airports, including the fence area, access gates, and controls. This complements the information in the prev_chunk about the annual report requirement and the role of the Assistant Secretary of Homeland Security. The curr_chunk mentions the Aviation Security Advisory Committee passing the House of Representatives on June 28, 2012, attested by Karen L. Haas, Clerk.
